reviews.review_msg: He is boring, Weird, and tries to be funny. He stares alot in a awkward way. Teaching is very boring, its hard not to fall asleep. Tests are ridiculous, I advise people not to take BISC333 with him.
Very clear, incredibly available to help students.  it's rare to get a prof who is so good at actually teaching the stuff they study.  Highly recommended.

Extremely helpful. Great notes! great lecturer. Funnnnny guy! he records the lectures which is really a big help. his little caption notes on pp sldes are super helpful! exams were fair but the course is hard! I wish he would teach more upper devision classes! Nick, if ur reading this, I'm giving you a chili pepper...and i'm a guy ;)

AWESOME and BEST Prof I've ever had! He's super funny and not rude at all (Why are people saying he is rude?) Includes all he plans to say in his slides, gives TONS of help if you need and goes the extra mile for his students. The only difficult thing about BISC333 is that the volume of info is huge but put in some effort and you'll do really well!

Nick is one of the best prof's you'll ever have at SFU.  Sure the material in the course is VERY tough, but Nick goes above and beyond to make sure his students get it.  He's also a really funny guy, which makes classes tolerable.  Overall I would highly recommend taking a class with him.  Very approachable and flexible in terms of office hours.

If you put in the effort you will do well; a great prof who goes the extra mile for his students. He puts a huge amount of time into this course with great slides, extra study guides and good tutorial set ups. Highly recommended!!

His slideshows are very detailed - the textbook might be nice as supplementary reading, but it is not necessary. His lectures are clear, interesting and humorous. His tests are long, but fair. The course is information heavy, but he makes it as painless as possible! Recommended!

I found him to be quite rude to students in class. However, he was very helpful outside of class and wanted his students to do well. I would not take another class from him. I found his exams to be unfair for the amount of time given, and offered students an unfair advantage for showing up early.
Gets way too excited about some topics like microtubules. Really funny guy. Bends over backwards to help students if you come and visit him.

He is an excellent professor!  His exams are challenging but completely fair, and he is very accessible for extra help.  He is also really nice and approachable.  I strongly recommend taking a class with him.  He is the best biology prof I have ever had.

AMAZING PROF! Best MBB and Bisc prof at the university so far. Notes are thorough,does podcasts and tests are fair. You do need to put the work in (its challenging stuff) but he couldn't be any more fascilitating, encouraging or helpful. You'd be a fool not to take his classes if you're fortunate enough to catch him
Very nice prof...concise notes and fair exams.  I strongly recommend taking a course with him!
Very clear about what is expected of students. It's easy to tell that Nick cares about his students. His exams are straightforward and very fair. Highly recommended, he's a great professor.
